subject: Management
title: The Decision Debt Concept
description: A quick, practical guide to The Decision Debt Concept.

hook.text: A company avoided a hard pricing decision for two years. When forced, the fix cost 10x more.

buildup.text: Every postponed decision accumulates interest, just like financial debt.

discovery.text: Decision debt compounds: the longer you wait, the more constrained your options become.

twist.text: Avoiding a decision feels like reducing risk. It actually increases future risk silently.

climax.text: Audit your open decisions quarterly. Which ones are quietly accumulating debt?

punchline.text: Delayed decisions don't disappear. They grow interest.

quiz.question: What is decision debt?
options: The compounding cost of postponing difficult decisions
Money spent on consultants to make decisions
The number of decisions a manager makes per day
